quote: God always answers our prayers; if there is a delay, it is because He has something better in mind for us. Don’t give up- we commit the mistake of giving up too soon thinking that God has forgotten us little realizing that He never forsakes His children. If you feel your prayers have not been answered, then keep praying, increase the intensity of your prayers till He gives you what you want.
author: Latika Teotia

quote: Never lose faith in God. Remember that He is always there by our side watching over us and steering us in the right direction. We are continuously evolving into better human beings and growing spiritually. It is during this process of evolution that we become confused, restless, depressed and even hostile because we are not aware of this change in us. We may even feel that God has forsaken us- which couldn’t be farther from the truth, because He will never leave you, no matter how difficult the times may be. It is this ignorance that is the cause of all our miseries and confusions; the realization comes only once we share our worries with someone knowledgeable who tells us about God and His mysterious ways of working. So never lose faith, always repose your trust in God.
author: Latika Teotia

quote: After all, when ‘the Lord saw how great the wickedness of the human race had become’ He resolved to ‘wipe from the face of the earth the human race I have created – and with them the animals, the birds and the creatures that move along the ground – for I regret that I have made them’ (Genesis 6:7). The Bible thinks it is perfectly all right to destroy all animals as punishment for the crimes of Homo sapiens, as if the existence of giraffes, pelicans and ladybirds has lost all purpose if humans misbehave. The Bible could not imagine a scenario in which God repents having created Homo sapiens, wipes this sinful ape off the face of the earth, and then spends eternity enjoying the antics of ostriches, kangaroos and panda bears.
author: Yuval Noah Harari, Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow

The same is for God.

quote: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.
author: Maurice Switzer

quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare, As You Like It

quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform (or pause and reflect).
author: Mark Twain
category: individuality, majority, minority, pause, reflect, wisdom

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
author: John Lennon

quote: Hold fast to dreams,For if dreams dieLife is a broken-winged bird,That cannot fly.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Never laugh at live dragons.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: The secret of life, though, is to fall seven times and to get up eight times.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle, Metaphysics

quote: Any fool can know. The point is to understand.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Think before you speak. Read before you think.
author: Fran Lebowitz, The Fran Lebowitz Reader
category: advice-for-daily-living, books, reader, reading, speaking, thinking, wisdom

quote: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

quote: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

quote: Angry people are not always wise.
author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice

quote: Let no man pull you so low as to hate him.
author: Martin Luther King Jr., A Knock at Midnight: Inspiration from the Great Sermons of Reverend Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings

quote: There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man.
author: Patrick Rothfuss, The Wise Man's Fear

quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
author: Leo Tolstoy, The Kreutzer Sonata
category: beauty, delusion, goodness, lies, self-deception, wisdom

quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Knowing others is intelligence
author: knowing yourself is true wisdom.Mastering others is strength

quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.
author: Colette

quote: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.
author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

quote: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.
author: J.M. Barrie, The Admirable Crichton

quote: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,That we may record our emptiness.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.
author: Bob Marley

quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi, Masnavi i Man'avi, the spiritual couplets of Maula

quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
author: Thomas Paine, A Letter Addressed to the Abbe Raynal on the Affairs of North America

quote: I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?""It is an act too often neglected," said the fox. "It means to establish ties." "To establish ties?" "Just that," said the fox. "To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need of you. And you, on your part, have no need of me. To you I am nothing more than a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But if you tame me, then we shall need each other. To me, you will be unique in all the world. To you, I shall be unique in all the world....
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Little Prince

quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
author: Leo Tolstoy, War and Peace

quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Fifth Mountain

quote: I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Perhaps the rare and simple pleasure of being seen for what one is compensates for the misery of being it.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.
author: Confucius

quote: We learn from failure, not from success!
author: Bram Stoker, Dracula
category: doubt, experience, learning, mistakes, records, wisdom

quote: Never, never, never give in!
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
author: Voltaire

quote: We shall not cease from explorationAnd the end of all our exploringWill be to arrive where we startedAnd know the place for the first time.
author: T.S. Eliot, Four Quartets

quote: There comes a point when you either embrace who and what you are, or condemn yourself to be miserable all your days. Other people will try to make you miserable; don't help them by doing the job yourself.
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy axe without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: All knowledge hurts.
author: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

quote: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.
author: Elizabeth Gaskell, Wives and Daughters

quote: Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge, Literary Remains, Vol. 1

quote: Risks must be taken because the greatest hazard in life is to risk nothing.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Mockingbirds don’t do one thing but make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corncribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird.
author: Harper Lee, To Kill a Mockingbird

quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Socrates

quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: Sometimes, if you stand on the bottom rail of a bridge and lean over to watch the river slipping slowly away beneath you, you will suddenly know everything there is to be known.
author: A.A. Milne

quote: This being human is a guest house. Every morning is a new arrival. A joy, a depression, a meanness, some momentary awareness comes as an unexpected visitor...Welcome and entertain them all. Treat each guest honorably. The dark thought, the shame, the malice, meet them at the door laughing, and invite them in. Be grateful for whoever comes, because each has been sent as a guide from beyond.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Wisdom cannot be imparted. Wisdom that a wise man attempts to impart always sounds like foolishness to someone else ... Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom. One can find it, live it, do wonders through it, but one cannot communicate and teach it.
author: Hermann Hesse, Siddhartha
category: communication, foolishness, knowledge, sharing, teaching, wisdom

quote: Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: It is one thing to be clever and another to be wise.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist.
author: Michael Levine

quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
author: Francis Bacon, The Essays

quote: If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing.
author: Oscar Wilde, The Soul of Man Under Socialism, and Selected Critical Prose

quote: As much money and life as you could want! The two things most human beings would choose above all - the trouble is, humans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
category: choices, eternal-life, human-desire, immortality, money, wisdom

quote: I ask not for any crownBut that which all may win
author: Nor try to conquer any worldExcept the one within.

quote: We seldom realize, for example that our most private thoughts and emotions are not actually our own. For we think in terms of languages and images which we did not invent, but which were given to us by our society.
author: Alan W. Watts
category: civilization, culture, names, power-of-words, responsibility, wisdom

quote: You're going to meet many people with domineering personalities: the loud, the obnoxious, those that noisily stake their claims in your territory and everywhere else they set foot on. This is the blueprint of a predator. Predators prey on gentleness, peace, calmness, sweetness and any positivity that they sniff out as weakness. Anything that is happy and at peace they mistake for weakness. It's not your job to change these people, but it's your job to show them that your peace and gentleness do not equate to weakness. I have always appeared to be fragile and delicate but the thing is, I am not fragile and I am not delicate. I am very gentle but I can show you that the gentle also possess a poison. I compare myself to silk. People mistake silk to be weak but a silk handkerchief can protect the wearer from a gunshot. There are many people who will want to befriend you if you fit the description of what they think is weak; predators want to have friends that they can dominate over because that makes them feel strong and important. The truth is that predators have no strength and no courage. It is you who are strong, and it is you who has courage. I have lost many a friend over the fact that when they attempt to rip me, they can't. They accuse me of being deceiving; I am not deceiving, I am just made of silk. It is they who are stupid and wrongly take gentleness and fairness for weakness. There are many more predators in this world, so I want you to be made of silk. You are silk.
author: C. JoyBell C.
category: be-wise, firm-resolve, inner-strength, inspirational-attitude, inspirational-life, inspirational-quotes, learning, life-and-living, living-and-learning, predators, silk, strength, warnings, weakness, wisdom, wisdom-quotes

quote: Suffering is a gift. In it is hidden mercy.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: I believe that what we become depends on what our fathers teach us at odd moments, when they aren't trying to teach us. We are formed by little scraps of wisdom.
author: Umberto Eco, Foucault's Pendulum

quote: Wise? No, I simply learned to think.
author: Christopher Paolini, Eldest

quote: When a child asks you something, answer him, for goodness sake. But don't make a production of it. Children are children, but they can spot an evasion faster than adults, and evasion simply muddles 'em.
author: Harper Lee, To Kill a Mockingbird

quote: Remember, you cannot be both young and wise. Young people who pretend to be wise to the ways of the world are mostly just cynics. Cynicism masquerades as wisdom, but it is the farthest thing from it. Because cynics don’t learn anything. Because cynicism is a self-imposed blindness, a rejection of the world because we are afraid it will hurt us or disappoint us. Cynics always say no. But saying “yes” begins things. Saying “yes” is how things grow. Saying “yes” leads to knowledge. “Yes” is for young people. So for as long as you have the strength to, say “yes'.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

quote: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

quote: The lotus is the most beautiful flower, whose petals open one by one. But it will only grow in the mud. In order to grow and gain wisdom, first you must have the mud --- the obstacles of life and its suffering. ... The mud speaks of the common ground that humans share, no matter what our stations in life. ... Whether we have it all or we have nothing, we are all faced with the same obstacles: sadness, loss, illness, dying and death. If we are to strive as human beings to gain more wisdom, more kindness and more compassion, we must have the intention to grow as a lotus and open each petal one by one.
author: Goldie Hawn
category: compassion, depression, flower, growth, illness, kindness, obstacles, perseverance, wisdom

quote: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
author: Albert Einstein
category: education, knowledge-wisdom, learning, school, science, wisdom

quote: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: I AM IGNORANT of absolute truth. But I am humble before my ignorance and therein lies my honor and my reward.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: It takes a very long time to become young.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Books loved anyone who opened them, they gave you secruity and friendship and didn't ask for anything in return; they never went away, never, not even when you treated them badly.
author: Cornelia Funke, Inkheart

quote: There is more in you of good than you know, child of the kindly West. Some courage and some wisdom, blended in measure. If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Hobbit

quote: Recognizing power in another does not diminish your own.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: Hide not your talents, they for use were made,What's a sundial in the shade?
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
author: Baltasar Gracián, The Art of Worldly Wisdom
category: advice, enemies, foolishness, friends, friendship, strategy, war, wisdom

quote: No man is poor who has a Godly mother.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: But magic is neither good nor evil. It is a tool, like a knife. Is a knife evil? Only if the wielder is evil.
author: Rick Riordan, The House of Hades

quote: Into the darkness they go, the wise and the lovely.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
author: Gautama Buddha, The Dhammapada: The Sayings of the Buddha

quote: Wisely and slow
author: they stumble that run fast.

quote: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door
author: Milton Berle

quote: wisdom comes to us when it can no longer do any good.
author: Gabriel García Márquez, Love in the Time of Cholera

quote: No, that is the great fallacy: the wisdom of old men. They do not grow wise. They grow careful.
author: Ernest Hemingway, A Farewell to Arms

quote: CHORONZON: I am a dire wolf, prey-stalking, lethal prowler.MORPHEUS: I am a hunter, horse-mounted, wolf-stabbing.CHORONZON: I am a horsefly, horse-stinging, hunter-throwing.MORPHEUS: I am a spider, fly-consuming, eight legged.CHORONZON: I am a snake, spider-devouring, posion-toothed.MORPHEUS: I am an ox, snake-crushing, heavy-footed.CHORONZON: I am an anthrax, butcher bacterium, warm-life destroying.MORPHEUS: I am a world, space-floating, life-nurturing.CHORONZON: I am a nova, all-exploding... planet-cremating.MORPHEUS: I am the Universe -- all things encompassing, all life embracing., Dreamlord?MORPHEUS: I am hope.
author: Neil Gaiman, Preludes & Nocturnes
category: competition, cunning, hope, insight, outwit, wisdom

quote: Lost Time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin, Poor Richard's Almanack

quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
author: Alfred Tennyson

quote: But what if I make a mistake?' Will asked.Gilan threw back his head and laughed. 'A mistake? One mistake? You should be so lucky. You'll make dozens! I made four or five on my first day alone! Of course you'll make mistakes. Just don't make any of them twice. If you do mess things up, don't try to hide it. Don't try to rationalize it. Recognize it and admit it and learn from it. We never stop learning, none of us.
author: John Flanagan, Erak's Ransom

quote: You will not be punished for your anger
author: you will be punished by your anger.

quote: Mama used to say, you have to know someone a thousand days before you can glimpse her soul.
author: Shannon Hale, Book of a Thousand Days

quote: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise.
author: Sara Teasdale, The Collected Poems

quote: Perhaps the logical conclusion of everyone looking the same is everyone thinking the same.
author: Scott Westerfeld, Uglies

quote: I used to think the worst thing in life is to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel all alone.
author: Robin Williams

quote: There is an ancient tribal proverb I once heard in India. It says that before we can see properly we must first shed our tears to clear the way.
author: Libba Bray, The Sweet Far Thing

quote: Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to take rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows neither victory nor defeat.
author: Theodore Roosevelt, Strenuous Life
category: decisiveness, fear, inaction, just-do-it, risk, timidity, wisdom

quote: As a well spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens, Hard Times

quote: In order to rise from its own ashes, a Phoenix first must burn.
author: Octavia E. Butler
category: empowerment, experience, masochism, memory, pain, wisdom

quote: The man of wisdom is never of two minds
author: the man of benevolence never worries
category: the man of courage is never afraid.

quote: The way out is through the door. Why is it that no one will use this method?
author: Confucius

quote: I've learned that you shouldn't go through life with a catcher's mitt on both hands
author: you need to be able to throw some things back.

quote: No one cares how much you know, until they know how much you care
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: My soul is in the sky.
author: William Shakespeare, A Midsummer Night's Dream

quote: When you look at what C.S. Lewis is saying, his message is so anti-life, so cruel, so unjust. The view that the Narnia books have for the material world is one of almost undisguised contempt. At one point, the old professor says, ‘It’s all in Plato’ — meaning that the physical world we see around us is the crude, shabby, imperfect, second-rate copy of something much better. I want to emphasize the simple physical truth of things, the absolute primacy of the material life, rather than the spiritual or the afterlife.]
author: Philip Pullman
category: basis, beauty, belief, book, books, children-s-books, offense, philip-pullman, value, wisdom, young-adult

quote: Now I understand that one of the important reasons for going to college and getting an education is to learn that the things you've believed in all your life aren't true, and that nothing is what it appears to be.
author: Daniel Keyes, Flowers for Algernon

quote: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not towisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
author: Wallace Stegner, The Spectator Bird
category: heartbreak, hurt, life-lessons, scars, wisdom, wounds

quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
author: Confucius

quote: Women may fall when there's no strength in men.Act II
author: William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

quote: These violent delights have violent ends.
author: William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Where wisdom reigns, there is no conflict between thinking and feeling.
author: C.G. Jung

quote: The small wisdom is like water in a glass:clear, transparent, pure.The great wisdom is like the water in the sea:dark, mysterious, impenetrable.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: A man without words is a man without thought.
author: John Steinbeck, East of Eden

quote: Sometimes you weren't supposed to share pain. Sometimes it was best just to deal with it alone.
author: Sarah Addison Allen, The Sugar Queen

quote: Water is the softest thing, yet it can penetrate mountains and earth. This shows clearly the principle ofsoftness overcoming hardness.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Love of music, of sunsets and sea; a liking for the same kind of people; political opinions that are not radically divergent; a similar stance as we look at the stars and think of the marvelous strangeness of the universe - these are what build a marriage. And it is never to be taken for granted.
author: Madeleine L'Engle, Two-Part Invention: The Story of a Marriage

quote: It’s always hard to lose somebody. It leaves a hole in you heart that never grows back.
author: Kevin Brooks, Lucas

quote: I do believe in simplicity. It is astonishing as well as sad, how many trivial affairs even the wisest thinks he must attend to in a day; how singular an affair he thinks he must omit. When the mathematician would solve a difficult problem, he first frees the equation of all incumbrances, and reduces it to its simplest terms. So simplify the problem of life, distinguish the necessary and the real. Probe the earth to see where your main roots run.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: If curiosity killed the cat, it was satisfaction that brought it back.
author: Holly Black, Tithe

quote: Time is not the great teacher. Experience is. A man may live a whole life, but if he never leaves his home to experience that life, he dies knowing nothing. A mere child who has suffered and lived can be the wiser of the two.
author: Lynsay Sands, Love Bites

quote: There are women who make things better... simply by showing up. There are women who make things happen. There are women who make their way. There are women who make a difference. And women who make us smile. There are women of wit and wisdom who- through strength and courage- make it through. There are women who change the world everyday... Women like you.
author: Ashley Rice

quote: You cannot teach a man anything, you can only help him find it within himself.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: So wise so young, they say, do never live long.
author: William Shakespeare, Richard III

quote: I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.
author: Eckhart Tolle, The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment
category: cat, cat-people, cats, integrity, meditation, peace, sereneity, spirituality, wisdom, zen, zen-master

quote: Is there a difference between happiness and inner peace? Yes. Happiness depends on conditions being perceived as positive
author: inner peace does not.

quote: The wisest are the most annoyed at the loss of time.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: It takes a great man to be a good listener.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Every immigrant who comes here should be required within five years to learn English or leave the country.
author: Theodore Roosevelt
category: advice, americanism, english-as-a-second-language, immigration, politics, usa, wisdom, xenophobia

quote: Treachery and violence are spears pointed at both ends
author: they wound those who resort to them worse than their enemies.

quote: Anger exceeding limits causes fear and excessive kindness eliminates respect.
author: Euripides

quote: It is easier to be wise for others than for ourselves.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quote: But that's how memory works," Bitterblue said quietly. "Things disappear without your permission, then come back again without your permission." And sometimes they came back incomplete and warped.
author: Kristin Cashore, Bitterblue

quote: Stories have a way of changing faces. They are unruly things, undisciplined, given to delinquency and the throwing of erasers. This is why we must close them up into thick, solid books, so they cannot get out and cause trouble.
author: Catherynne M. Valente, The Girl Who Circumnavigated Fairyland in a Ship of Her Own Making

quote: The happiness of the drop is to die in the river.
author: حجة الإسلام أبي حامد محمد الغزالي

quote: Sanity calms, but madness is more interesting.
author: John Russell

quote: Yet what keeps me from dissolving right now into a complete fairy-tale shimmer is this solid truth, a truth which has veritably built my bones over the last few years--I was not rescued by a prince; I was the administrator of my own rescue.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love

quote: I will not deny but that the best apology against false accusers is silence and sufferance, and honest deeds set against dishonest words.
author: John Milton

quote: Wisdom.... comes not from age, but from education and learning.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: When in doubt, choose to live.
author: Terry Pratchett, Thief of Time

quote: Books permit us to voyage through time, to tap the wisdom of our ancestors. The library connects us with the insight and knowledge, painfully extracted from Nature, of the greatest minds that ever were, with the best teachers, drawn from the entire planet and from all our history, to instruct us without tiring, and to inspire us to make our own contribution to the collective knowledge of the human species. I think the health of our civilization, the depth of our awareness about the underpinnings of our culture and our concern for the future can all be tested by how well we support our libraries.
author: Carl Sagan, Cosmos
category: books, civilization, education, history, knowledge, libraries, wisdom

quote: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying in other words that he is wiser today than he was yesterday.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: How prone to doubt, how cautious are the wise!
author: Homer

quote: When you've learned to laugh at the things that should be laughed at, and not to laugh at those that shouldn't, you've got wisdom and understanding.
author: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of the Island

quote: Wisdom is the reward for surviving our own stupidity.
author: Brian Rathbone, Regent

quote: I have studied many philosophers and many cats. The wisdom of cats is infinitely superior.
author: Hippolyte Taine
category: animals, cats, intelligence, philosophers, smart, wisdom

quote: But if you believe yourself worthy of the thing you fought so hard to get, then you become an instrument of God, you help the Soul of the World, and you understand why you are here.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

quote: I'm trying to undermine the basis of Christian belief... I'm not in the business of offending people. I find the books upholding certain values that I think are important, such as life is immensely valuable and this world is an extraordinarily beautiful place. We should do what we can to increase the amount of wisdom in the world.]
author: Philip Pullman
category: basis, beauty, belief, book, books, children-s-books, offense, paraphrased, philip-pullman, plot, value, wisdom, young-adult

quote: Conceit spoils the finest genius.
author: Louisa May Alcott, Little Women

quote: In fact, the mere act of opening the box will determine the state of thecat, although in this case there were three determinate states the catcould be in: these being Alive, Dead, and Bloody Furious.
author: Terry Pratchett, Lords and Ladies

quote: If I had to live my life again, I'd make the same mistakes, only sooner.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night. In their gray visions they obtain glimpses of eternity, and thrill, in waking, to find that they have been upon the verge of the great secret. In snatches, they learn something of the wisdom which is of good, and more of the mere knowledge which is of evil.
author: Edgar Allan Poe, Edgar Allan Poe: Complete Tales and Poems

quote: Dieting is the only game where you win when you lose!
author: Karl Lagerfeld
category: diet, dieting, fashion-designer, game, image, look, lose, pounds, weight, win, winning, wisdom, wise, woman, women

quote: When you're in a Slump,you're not in for much fun.Un-slumping yourselfis not easily done.
author: Dr. Seuss, Oh, The Places You'll Go!

quote: My father always used to say, "Don't raise your voice. Improve your argument." Good sense does not always lie with the loudest shouters, nor can we say that a large, unruly crowd is always the best arbiter of what is right.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: You are an explorer, and you represent our species, and the greatest good you can do is to bring back a new idea, because our world is endangered by the absence of good ideas. Our world is in crisis because of the absence of consciousness.
author: Terence McKenna

quote: The fact that man knows right from wrong proves his intellectual superiority to the other creatures
author: but the fact that he can do wrong proves his moral inferiority to any creatures that cannot.

quote: To wisely live your life, you don't need to know muchJust remember two main rules for the beginning:You better starve, than eat whateverAnd better be alone, than with whoever.
author: Omar Khayyám, Rubaiyat

quote: He who is certain he knows the ending of things when he is only beginning them is either extremely wise or extremely foolish; no matter which is true, he is certainly an unhappy man, for he has put a knife in the heart of wonder.
author: Tad Williams, The Dragonbone Chair

quote: Time flows away like the water in the river.
author: Confucius

quote: Mistakes are the growing pains of wisdom.
author: William Jordan

quote: The nail that sticks out farthest gets hammered the hardest.
author: Patrick Jones, Nailed

quote: Fame is a vapor, popularity is an accident, riches take wings, those who cheer today may curse tomorrow and only one thing endures - character.
author: Harry Truman

quote: He hated when his own advice applied to himself.
author: Rick Riordan, The Blood of Olympus

quote: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
author: William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

quote: I do not know everything
author: still many things I understand.
category: Madeleine L'Engle, A Wrinkle in Time

quote: A desire not to butt into other people's business is at least eighty percent of all human wisdom.
author: Robert A. Heinlein, Stranger in a Strange Land

quote: Travel brings wisdom only to the wise. It renders the ignorant more ignorant than ever.
author: Joe Abercrombie, Last Argument of Kings

quote: The first peace, which is the most important, is that which comes within the souls of people when they realize their relationship, their oneness with the universe and all its powers, and when they realize at the center of the universe dwells the Great Spirit, and that its center is really everywhere, it is within each of us.
author: Black Elk
category: body, mind, peace, spirit, spirituality, wisdom

quote: I have always felt that doubt was the beginning of wisdom, and the fear of God was the end of wisdom.
author: Clarence Darrow, The Story of My Life

quote: Sometimes wisdom came from strange places, even from giant teenaged goldfish.
author: Rick Riordan, The Mark of Athena

quote: Even as a solid rock is unshaken by the wind, so are the wise unshaken by praise or blame.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: I like places like this," he announced.I like old places too," Josh said, "but what's to like about a place like this?"The king spread his arms wide. "What do you see?"Josh made a face. "Junk. Rusted tractor, broken plow, old bike."Ahh...but I see a tractor that was once used to till these fields. I see the plow it once pulled. I see a bicycle carefully placed out of harm's way under a table."Josh slowly turned again, looking at the items once more.And i see these things and I wonder at the life of the person who carefully stored the precious tractor and plow in the barn out of the weather, and placed their bike under a homemade table."Why do you wonder?" Josh asked. "Why is it even important?"Because someone has to remember," Gilgamesh snapped, suddenly irritated. "Some one has to remember the human who rode the bike and drove the tractor, the person who tilled the fields, who was born and lived and died, who loved and laughed and cried, the person who shivered in the cold and sweated in the sun." He walked around the barn again, touching each item, until his palm were red with rust." It is only when no one remembers, that you are truely lost. That is the true death.
author: Michael Scott, The Sorceress

quote: Before you become too entranced with gorgeous gadgets and mesmerizing video displays, let me remind you that information is not knowledge, knowledge is not wisdom, and wisdom is not foresight. Each grows out of the other, and we need them all.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: I look back now and realize that the gift of a true friend is that she sees you not the way you see yourself or the way others see you. A true friend sees you for who you are and who you can become.
author: Robin Jones Gunn, Sisterchicks Say Ooh La La!

quote: We're all fools," said Clemens, "all the time. It's just we're a different kind each day. We think, I'm not a fool today. I've learned my lesson. I was a fool yesterday but not this morning. Then tomorrow we find out that, yes, we were a fool today too. I think the only way we can grow and get on in this world is to accept the fact we're not perfect and live accordingly.
author: Ray Bradbury, The Illustrated Man

quote: Wisdom comes through suffering.Trouble, with its memories of pain,Drips in our hearts as we try to sleep,So men against their willLearn to practice moderation.Favours come to us from gods.
author: Aeschylus, Agamemnon
category: favors, gods, memory, moderation, pain, sleep, suffering, wisdom

quote: Can you look without the voice in your head commenting, drawing conclusions, comparing, or trying to figure something out?
author: Eckhart Tolle, A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life's Purpose

quote: I'VE LEARNED THAT YOU CAN'T CONTROL WHAT OTHER PEOPLE ARE GOING TO THINK ABOUT YOU.THE BEST YOU CAN DO IN LIFE IS NOT PISS YOURSELFOFF.
author: Megan McCafferty, Second Helpings

quote: Many have died
author: you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.

quote: Peace is not happenstance. It is a living fire that must be fed constantly. It must be tended to with vigilance, else it dies out.
author: Libba Bray, The Sweet Far Thing

quote: You'll never reach perfection because there's always room for improvement. Yet get along the way to perfection, you'll learn to get better.
author: Hlovate, Versus

quote: And I despise your books, I despise wisdom and the blessings of this world. It is all worthless, fleeting, illusory, and deceptive, like a mirage. You may be proud, wise, and fine, but death will wipe you off the face of the earth as though you were no more than mice burrowing under the floor, and your posterity, your history, your immortal geniuses will burn or freeze together with the earthly globe.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Time ripens all things
author: no man is born wise.

quote: I thought to myself: I am wiser than this man; neither of us probably knows anything that is really good, but he thinks he has knowledge, when he has not, while I, having no knowledge, do not think I have.
author: Plato, Apology

quote: We need not take refuge in supernatural gods to explain our saints and sages and heroes and statesmen, as if to explain our disbelief that mere unaided human beings could be that good or wise.
author: Abraham H. Maslow
category: disbelief, explain, gods, good, heroes, sages, statesmen, supernatural, superstition, wisdom, wise

quote: A fool's paradise is a wise man's hell.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: You look up when you wish to be exalted. And I look down because I am exalted.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Thus Spoke Zarathustra

quote: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.
author: Socrates

quote: For with much wisdom comes much sorrow
author: the more knowledge the more grief.
category: Anonymous, Holy Bible: King James Version

quote: Is it so far from madness to wisdom?" - Daenerys Targaryen
author: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

quote: Men have two greatest fears: the first fear is the fear of being needed, and the second fear is the fear of not being needed.
author: C. JoyBell C.
category: fear, fears, life-and-living, men, men-s-fears, paradox, the-fears-of-man, the-man, the-nature-of-man, wisdom, wisdom-quotes

quote: ...Nobody knows like a woman how to say things that are both sweet and profound. Sweetness and depth, this is all of woman; this is Heaven.
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

quote: Healthy citizens are the greatest asset any country can have.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise
author: seek what they sought.

quote: To hide feelings when you are near crying is the secret of dignity.
author: Dejan Stojanovic
category: crying, dejan-stojanovic, dignity, feelings, hide, literature, literature-quotes, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, quotes-to-live-by, secret, thoughts, wisdom

quote: The wise are not wise because they make no mistakes. They are wise because they correct their mistakes as soon as they recognize them.
author: Orson Scott Card, Xenocide

quote: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
author: Horace
category: act, action, begin, beginnings, bold, boldness, venture, wisdom, wise

quote: If everything seems under control, you're not going fast enough.
author: Mario Andretti

quote: All truly wise thoughts have been thought already thousands of times; but to make them truly ours, we must think them over again honestly, until they take root in our personal experience.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Liberty without Learning is always in peril and Learning without Liberty is always in vain.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: There will come a time in your life when you lose something that matters to you. You'll fight for it and you won't win. But what really matters isn't the war you're waging, it's that you don't lose the person you are in the midst of the battle.
author: J. Sterling, The Perfect Game
category: battle, fight, insparation, lose, mature-ya, wisdom

quote: Do not look for happiness outside yourself. The awakened seek happiness inside.
author: Petar Dunov
category: awakened, enlightenment, happiness, inner-peace, self-fulfillment, wisdom

quote: Veganism is not about giving anything up or losing anything
author: it is about gaining the peace within yourself that comes from embracing nonviolence and refusing to participate in the exploitation of the vulnerable

quote: Anarchism is founded on the observation that since few men are wise enough to rule themselves, even fewer are wise enough to rule others.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: One must find the source within one's own Self, one must possess it. Everything else was seeking -- a detour, an error.
author: Hermann Hesse, Siddhartha

quote: Lucy: You learn more when you lose Charlie Brown: Well then I must be the smartest person in world!!!
author: Charles M. Schulz, Peanuts Treasury

quote: He who doesn't understand history is doomed to repeat it.
author: Pittacus Lore, I Am Number Four

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides, The Bacchae

quote: Suppose that we are wise enough to learn and know—and yet not wise enough to control our learning and knowledge, so that we use it to destroy ourselves? Even if that is so, knowledge remains better than ignorance. It is better to know—even if the knowledge endures only for the moment that comes before destruction—than to gain eternal life at the price of a dull and swinish lack of comprehension of a universe that swirls unseen before us in all its wonder. That was the choice of Achilles, and it is mine, too.
author: Isaac Asimov
category: achilles, choice, ignorance, knowledge, learning, science, universe, wisdom, wise

quote: The wise man knows that it is better to sit on the banks of a remote mountain stream than to be emperor of the whole world.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: Goodness without wisdom always accomplishes evil.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: youth is easily deceived because it is quick to hope.
author: Aristotle

quote: Education is no substitute for intelligence.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: If we never experience the chill of a dark winter, it is very unlikely that we will ever cherish the warmth of a bright summer’s day. Nothing stimulates our appetite for the simple joys of life more than the starvation caused by sadness or desperation. In order to complete our amazing life journey successfully, it is vital that we turn each and every dark tear into a pearl of wisdom, and find the blessing in every curse.
author: Anthon St. Maarten, Divine Living: The Essential Guide To Your True Destiny
category: appreciation, blessing, blessings, blessings-in-disguise, curse, dark-night-of-the-soul, desperation, dualism, duality, gratitude, happiness, joy, life-journey, life-lessons, light-and-darkness, pearls, sadness, tears, wisdom, yin-and-yang

quote: Adventure is not outside man
author: it is within.

quote: Everybody gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Gamitin ang puso para alagaan ang taong malapit sayo. Gamitin ang utakpara alagaan ang sarili mo.
author: Bob Ong

quote: It is beautiful to express love and even more beautiful to feel it.
author: Dejan Stojanovic
category: beautiful, beauty, dejan-stojanovic, express, expression, feel, feelings, literature, literature-quotes, love, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, quotes-to-live-by, thoughts, wisdom

quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
author: Voltaire

quote: Getting divorced just because you don't love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quote: A path is made by walking on it.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: Capabilities are clearly manifested only when they have been realized.
author: Simone de Beauvoir, The Second Sex

quote: I have come to the conclusion never again to think of marrying, and for this reason, I can never be satisfied with anyone who would be blockhead enough to have me.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: If a man could have half of his wishes, he would double his troubles.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Anyone who cannot cope with mathematics is not fully human. At best, he is a tolerable subhuman who has learned to wear his shoes, bathe, and not make messes in the house.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: May your feet ever walk in the light of two suns... and may the moonshadow never fall on you...
author: Robert Fanney
category: fantasy, light, luthiel, moon, mystery, shadow, suns, wisdom

quote: Being alive is sign of strength!
author: Hiro Mashima, フェアリーテイル 31 講談社キャラクターズA [Fearī Teiru 31 Special Edition DVD Bundle]

quote: Wherever I go, I meet myself.
author: Dejan Stojanovic, The Shape
category: dejan-stojanovic, literature, literature-quotes, myself, myself-quatation, poems, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, run, thoughts, wisdom

quote: I visited many places, Some of them quite Exotic and far away, But I always returned to myself.
author: Dejan Stojanovic
category: always, dejan-stojanovic, far-away, literature, literature-quotes, myself, places, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, quotes-to-live-by, returning, thoughts, visits, wisdom

quote: I don't fancy colors of the face, I'm always attracted to colors of the brain.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: africa, africans, amorous, apartheid, attraction, black-people, color, common-sense, face, falling-in-love, fancy, human-beings, intelligence, knowledge, liking, love, memories, memory, michael-bassey-johnson, nigerians, race, wisdom, wise, wise-men, wise-people

quote: Okay, this is the wisdom. First, time spent on reconnaissanse is never wasted. Second, almost anything can be improved with the addition of bacon. And finally, there is no problem on Earth that can't be ameliorated by a hot bath and a cup of tea.
author: Jasper Fforde, Shades of Grey
category: bacon, hot-baths, humour, problem, reconnaissance, tea, time, wisdom

quote: Silence does not always mark wisdom.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Every form of art is another way of seeing the world. Another perspective, another window. And science –that’s the most spectacular window of all. You can see the entire universe from there.
author: Claudia Gray, A Thousand Pieces of You

quote: Use the wings of the flying Universe, Dream with open eyes; See in darkness.
author: Dejan Stojanovic
category: darkness, dejan-stojanovic, dreams, flying, literature, literature-quotes, open-eyes, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, quotes-to-live-by, see, thoughts, wings, wisdom

quote: Because some things are never meant to be anything more than a moment. And that was one of them.
author: Kevin Brooks, Lucas

quote: Life is like a sandwich!Birth as one slice,and death as the other.What you put in-between the slices is up to you.Is your sandwich tasty or sour?Allan Rufus.org
author: Allan Rufus
category: anxiety, art-of-dying, art-of-living, depression, enlightenment, hang-man, know-thyself, knowing, knowing-oneself, knowledge, knowledge-education, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-teaching, love, master, master-key, master-of-love, masters, mastery, mind, mind-body-spirit, mind-power, personal-development, personal-growth, positive-attitude, positive-mindset, positive-motivation, positive-outlook, positive-quotes, positive-thinking, positive-thoughts, power-of-love, power-of-thoughts, power-of-words, powerful-story, quote, sacred, sacred-teachings, sacred-wisdom, sage, sage-advice, self-esteem, self-help-book, self-improvement, self-improvement-book, soul, soul-searching, spirit, spiritual-development, spiritual-growth, spiritual-wisdom, spiritualism, suicidal-thoughts, suicide, teachings, unconditional-acceptance, unconditional-love, wisdom, wise-man

quote: I would rather be able to appreciate things I cannot have than to have things I am not able to appreciate.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Jasnah had once defined a fool as a person who ignored information because it disagreed with desired results.
author: Brandon Sanderson, Words of Radiance
category: bias, bickering, disagreement, falacy, fool, information, intelligence, politics, religion, science, stupidity, wisdom

quote: There are many goals but one path - the path of compassion.
author: Amit Ray, Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
category: compassion, goal, kindness, life-positive, light, love, spirit, wisdom, yoga, yoga-inspiration

quote: Ignorance is hardly unusual, Miss Davar. The longer I live, the more I come to realize that it is the natural state of the human mind. There are many who will strive to defend its sanctity and then expect you to be impressed with their efforts.
author: Brandon Sanderson, The Way of Kings
category: human-mind, ignorance, mind, religion-and-science, religion-vs-science, science, science-and-religion, science-vs-religion, wisdom

quote: Mum liked to say that some things happen for a reason, that sometimes obstacles were there to stop you from doing something stupid.
author: Maggie Stiefvater, The Scorpio Races

quote: I feel with some passion that what we truly are is private, and almost infinitely complex, and ambiguous, and both external and internal, and double- or triple- or multiply natured, and largely mysterious even to ourselves; and furthermore that what we are is only part of us, because identity, unlike "identity", must include what we do. And I think that to find oneself and every aspect of this complexity reduced in the public mind to one property that apparently subsumes all the rest ("gay", "black", "Muslim", whatever) is to be the victim of a piece of extraordinary intellectual vulgarity.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: There is another alphabet, whispering from every leaf, singing from every river, shimmering from every sky.
author: Dejan Stojanovic
category: alphabet, another, dejan-stojanovic, leaf, literature, literature-quotes, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, river, rivers, shimmering, singing, sky, thoughts, whispering, wisdom

quote: What one thinks is right is not always the same as what others think is right
author: no one can be always right.

quote: How you spend your time is more important than how you spend your money. Money mistakes can be corrected, but time is gone forever.
author: David Norris

quote: I believe much trouble and blood would be saved if we opened our hearts more.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: Praise not the day until evening has come, a woman until she is burnt, a sword until it is tried, a maiden until she is married, ice until it has been crossed, beer until it has been drunk.
author: Michael Crichton, Eaters of the Dead

quote: If you don't feel it, flee from it. Go where you are celebrated, not merely tolerated.
author: Paul F. Davis

quote: Morality is temporary, wisdom is permanent.
author: Hunter S. Thompson, Kingdom of Fear: Loathsome Secrets of a Star-Crossed Child in the Final Days of the American Century

quote: Realize that everything connects to everything else.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: I was tired of seeing the Graces always depicted as beautiful young things. I think wisdom comes with age and life and pain. And knowing what matters.
author: Louise Penny, A Fatal Grace

quote: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.
author: Erasmus

quote: What happens to people living in a society where everyone in power is lying, stealing, cheating and killing, and in our hearts we all know this, but the consequences of facing all these lies are so monstrous, we keep on hoping that maybe the corporate government administration and media are on the level with us this time.Americans remind me of survivors of domestic abuse.This is always the hope that this is the very, very, very last time one's ribs get re-broken again.
author: Inga Muscio, Cunt: A Declaration of Independence

quote: He who acts, spoils; he who grasps, lets slip.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine.
author: H.L. Mencken, A Mencken Chrestomathy

quote: Love is wise; hatred is foolish. In this world, which is getting more and more closely interconnected, we have to learn to tolerate each other, we have to learn to put up with the fact that some people say things that we don't like. We can only live together in that way. But if we are to live together, and not die together, we must learn a kind of charity and a kind of tolerance, which is absolutely vital to the continuation of human life on this planet.
author: Bertrand Russell
category: charity, disagreement, foolishness, hatred, humanity, interconnectedness, love, tolerance, wisdom

quote: God is the supreme uncreated light of which Wisdom is born, but there was never a time when God's Wisdom did not exist.
author: Merritt Y. Hughes, Ten Perspectives on Milton

quote: We understand more than we know.
author: Margaret Atwood, Oryx and Crake

quote: Advice," Doña Vorchenza chuckled. "Advice. The years play a sort of alchemical trick, transmuting one's mutterings to a state of respectability. Give advice at forty and you're a nag. Give it at seventy and you're a sage.
author: Scott Lynch, The Lies of Locke Lamora

quote: Knowledge is merely brilliance in organization of ideas and not wisdom. The truly wise person goes beyond knowledge.
author: Confucius

quote: It seems wisest to assume the worst from the beginning...and let anything better come as a surprise.
author: Jules Verne, The Mysterious Island

quote: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: I am the shore and the ocean, awaiting myself on both sides.
author: Dejan Stojanovic, The Shape
category: dejan-stojanovic, literature, literature-quotes, ocean, poems, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, shore, thoughts, wisdom

quote: Wisdom ain't a virtue I ever aspired to.
author: Moira Young, Blood Red Road

quote: Once the writer in every individual comes to life (and that time is not far off), we are in for an age of universal deafness and lack of understanding.
author: Milan Kundera, The Book of Laughter and Forgetting

quote: Failure is instructive. The person who really thinks learns quite as much from his failures as from his successes.
author: John Dewey

quote: Clear thinking at the wrong moment can stifle creativity.
author: Karl Lagerfeld
category: art, clear, create, creativity, design, fashion-designer, icon, moment, right, stifle, time, wisdom, wrong

quote: Only ignorance excuses stupidity
author: Nalini Singh, Angels' Blood

quote: And, at such a time, for a few of us there will always be a tugging at the heart—knowing a precious moment had gone and we not there. We can ask and ask but we can’t have again what once seemed ours for ever—the way things looked, that church alone in the fields, a bed on belfry floor, a remembered voice, a loved face. They’ve gone and you can only wait for the pain to pass.
author: J.L. Carr, A Month in the Country

quote: Where are you? HereWhat time is it? NowWhat are you? This moment.
author: Dan Millman, Way of the Peaceful Warrior: A Book That Changes Lives

quote: We do learn and develop when we are exposed to those who are greater than we are. Perhaps this is the chief way we mature.
author: Madeleine L'Engle, Two-Part Invention: The Story of a Marriage

quote: It takes a lot of rehearsing for a man to be himself.
author: William Saroyan

quote: But then one regrets the loss even of one's worst habits. Perhaps one regrets them the most. They are such an essential part of one's personality.
author: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

quote: There were many terrible things in my life and most of them never happened.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The revolution is not an apple that falls when ripe. You have to make it fall.
author: Ernesto Che Guevara

quote: A point of view can be a dangerous luxury when substituted for insight andunderstanding.
author: Marshall McLuhan, The Gutenberg Galaxy: The Making of Typographic Man
category: insight, opinion, probes, social-science, understanding, wisdom

quote: With every part you act, there must be a little of yourself in it. If there isn't, it's not acting. It's lying.
author: Johnny Depp

quote: Chase away sorrow by living
author: Melissa Marr, Darkest Mercy

quote: I don’t think it would have all got me quite so down if just once in a while—just once in a while—there was at least some polite little perfunctory implication that knowledge should lead to wisdom, and that if it doesn't, it's just a disgusting waste of time! But there never is! You never even hear any hints dropped on a campus that wisdom is supposed to be the goal of knowledge. You hardly ever even hear the word 'wisdom' mentioned!
author: J.D. Salinger, Franny and Zooey

quote: Affliction is often that thing which prepares an ordinary person for some sort of an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: The Master said, “A true teacher is one who, keeping the past alive, is also able to understand the present.”(Analects 2.11)
author: Confucius

quote: We need houses as we need clothes, architecture stimulates fashion. It’s like hunger and thirst — you need them both.
author: Karl Lagerfeld
category: architecture, art, clothes, clothing, designer, fashion, hunger, karl-lagerfeld, need, needs, people, quote, quotes, stimulate, thirst, wisdom, woman, women

quote: With age comes wisdom, but sometimes age comes alone.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Don't be jealous of anyone. I guarantee you, if everyone walked into a room, and dumped their problems onto the floor, when they saw what everyone else's problems were, they'd be scrambling to get their own problems back before someone else got to them first.
author: Kim Gruenenfelder, A Total Waste of Makeup

quote: The barrier during self-improvement is not so much that we hate learning, rather we hate being taught. To learn entails that the knowledge was achieved on one's own accord - it feels great - but to be taught often leaves a feeling of inferiority. Thus it takes a bit of determination and a lot of humility in order for one to fully develop.
author: Criss Jami, Killosophy
category: achievement, barrier, determination, development, feelings, help, helping-hand, humility, improvement, inferiority, intelligence, knowledge, learning, self-improvement, taught, teaching, wisdom

quote: The immature think that knowledge and action are different, but the wise see them as the same.
author: Anonymous, Bhagavad Gita: El Canto del Senor

quote: Veganism is not a "sacrifice." It is a joy.
author: Gary L. Francione
category: abolition, abolitionist, ahimsa, animals, francione, inspirational-quotes, joy, justice, life-lessons, nonviolence, nonviolence-jainism, peace-making, peace-movement, peace-on-earth, rights, veganism, vulnerable, wisdom

quote: The beginning of wisdom, as they say. When you're seventeen you know everything. When you're twenty-seven if you still know everything you're still seventeen.
author: Ray Bradbury, Dandelion Wine

quote: well, sometimes to get what you want the most, you have to do what you want the least.
author: Jodi Picoult, My Sister's Keeper

quote: Take the matter as you find it ask no questions, utter no remonstrances; it is your best wisdom. You expected bread and you have got a stone: break your teeth on it, and don't shriek because the nerves are martyrised; do not doubt that your mental stomach - if you have such a thing - is strong as an ostrich's; the stone will digest. You held out your hand for an egg, and fate put into it a scorpion. Show no consternation; close your fingers firmly upon the gift; let it sting through your palm. Never mind; in time, after your hand and arm have swelled and quivered long with torture, the squeezed scorpion will die, and you will have learned the great lesson how to endure without a sob.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: You see, the best thing about wrong decisions is that they don’t prevent you from making the right decisions later on. It’s harder, but it’s not impossible.
author: Siobhan Vivian, Not That Kind of Girl

quote: It is a very sad thing that nowadays there is so little useless information.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: We never know the worth of water till the well is dry.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: She wondered when her daughter would realise that for the most part, people weren't that different. Young and old, male or female, pretty much everyone she knew wanted the same things: The wanted to feel peace in their hearts, they wanted a life without turmoil, they wanted to be happy. The difference, she thought, was that most young people seemed to think that those things lay somewhere in the future. While most older people believed that they lay in the past.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: A person is wise if he listens to millions of advice and doesn't implement any of it.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: advice, believe-in-yourself, courage, dependence, dignity, good-behaviour, implementation, indifference, michael-bassey-johnson, nonchalance, not-moved, opinion, opinions, pride, self-esteem, standard, standing-firm, standing-your-ground, trust, voice, wisdom, wise, witty

quote: I don’t think man was meant to attain happiness so easily. Happiness is like those palaces in fairy tales whose gates are guarded by dragons: we must fight in order to conquer it.
author: Alexandre Dumas, The Count of Monte Cristo

quote: Yeah. I mean, acknowledging is easy. Something happened or it didn't. But understanding... that's where things get sticky.
author: Sarah Dessen, What Happened to Goodbye

quote: Whenever a theory appears to you as the only possible one, take this as a sign that you have neither understood the theory nor the problem which it was intended to solve.
author: Karl R. Popper
category: dogmatism, idealism, maturity, pragmatism, science, theory, wisdom

quote: Wisdom is one of the few things that looks bigger the further away it is.
author: Terry Pratchett, Witches Abroad

quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
author: Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching

quote: True kindness isn't something we're born with. It's something we have to work at. Not everyone has it. But I think everyone has the potential. Sometimes you just have to look really close before you can tell it's there."-Kyoko
author: Natsuki Takaya

quote: Aw I don't wanta go to no such thing, I just wanta drink in alleys.'...But you'll miss all that, just for some old wine.'There's wisdom in wine, goddam it!' I yelled. 'Have a shot!
author: Jack Kerouac, The Dharma Bums

quote: Experience teaches us that it is much easier to prevent an enemy from posting themselves than it is to dislodge them after they have got possession.
author: George Washington

quote: The lessons of life amount not to wisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
author: Wallace Stegner, The Spectator Bird

quote: We must not think of the things we could do with, but only of the things that we can't do without.
author: Jerome K. Jerome, Three Men in a Boat

quote: I'm not sure why I've decided to do this. I'm not any stronger than I was, and nothing else has changed. But all the same, this time I'm not going to run away. It's okay to feel weak sometimes. It's okay to be afraid. The important thing is that we face our fears. That's what makes us strong."-Yuki
author: Natsuki Takaya

quote: Today the greatest single source of wealth is between your ears.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: When something seems wrong in your life, the only way to have resolution with it is to let it go. Trying to make it right keeps it wrong.
author: Beth Johnson

quote: Don't you notice that there are particular moments when you are naturally inspired to introspection? Work with them gently, for these are the moments when you can go through a powerful experience, and your whole worldview can change quickly.
author: Sogyal Rinpoche

quote: If you are not vegan, please consider going vegan. It’s a matter of nonviolence. Being vegan is your statement that you reject violence to other sentient beings, to yourself, and to the environment, on which all sentient beings depend.
author: Gary L. Francione
category: abolition, abolitionist, ahimsa, animals, education, exploitation, francione, inspirational-quotes, justice, life, nonviolence, nonviolence-jainism, peace-making, peace-movement, peace-on-earth, rights, sentience, slavery, veganism, wisdom

quote: To finish the moment, to find the journey's end in every step of the road, to live the greatest number of good hours, is wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The truth is always something that is told, not something that is known. If there were no speaking or writing, there would be no truth about anything. There would only be what is.
author: Susan Sontag, The Benefactor

quote: Jewels can be replaced, cousin. Independence, once lost, cannot.
author: R.L. LaFevers, Dark Triumph

quote: Penetrate deep into the word "Om". Gradually the word will disappear and only the silence will remain. The word is a support. The meaning is within you. Om brings out that meaning which is hidden in your soul.
author: Amit Ray, Om Chanting and Meditation
category: meaning-of-om, meditation, om, om-chanting, om-meditation, silence, silence-speaks, silence-within, soul, soul-quotes, wisdom

quote: Every intelligent individual wants to know what makes him tick, and yet is at once fascinated and frustrated by the fact that oneself is the most difficult of all things to know.
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study;but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
author: Marilyn Vos Savant

quote: I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus

quote: Writing about the unholy is one way of writing about what is sacred.
author: Clive Barker

quote: I call that man awake who, with conscious knowledge and understanding, can perceive the deep unreasoning powers in his soul, his whole innermost strength, desire and weakness, and knows how to reckon with himself.
author: Hermann Hesse, Narcissus and Goldmund

quote: Never question another man's motive. His wisdom, yes, but not his motives.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: No one lives long enough to learn everything they need to learn starting from scratch. To be successful, we absolutely, positively have to find people who have already paid the price to learn the things that we need to learn to achieve our goals.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: I am so wise I had my mouth sewn shut.
author: John Berryman

quote: I believe it is the mark of a great leader to question the decisions that came before him.
author: Marissa Meyer, Cress

quote: I don't trust men everybody likes. Being nice isn't the same as being good.
author: Sarah Rees Brennan, The Demon's Covenant

quote: There is no such uncertainty as a sure thing.
author: Robert Burns, Collected Poems of Robert Burns

quote: Men talk of killing time, while time quietly kills them.
author: Dion Boucicault

quote: You can never know everything. Part of what you know is always wrong. Perhaps the most important part. A portion of wisdom lies in knowing that. A portion of knowledge lies in going on anyway.
author: Robert  Jordan

quote: Wise men profit more by fools than fools by wise men.
author: Marcus Porcius Cato

quote: There is no one way to salvation, whatever the manner in which a man may proceed. All forms and variations are governed by the eternal intelligence of the Universe that enables a man to approach perfection. It may be in the arts of music and painting or it may be in commerce, law, or medicine. It may be in the study of war or the study of peace. Each is as important as any other. Spiritual enlightenment through religious meditation such as Zen or in any other way is as viable and functional as any "Way."... A person should study as they see fit.
author: Miyamoto Musashi, A Book of Five Rings: The Classic Guide to Strategy

quote: The noble man is chiefly concerned with wisdom and friendship; of these, the former is a mortal good, the latter and immortal one.
author: Epicurus

quote: It's always hard to remember love - years pass and you say to yourself, Was I really in love, or was I just kidding myself? Was I really in love, or was I just pretending he was the man of my dreams? Was I really in love, or was I just desperate?
author: Nora Ephron, I Feel Bad about My Neck: And Other Thoughts on Being a Woman
category: aging, illusion, love, relationships, true-love, wisdom

quote: Nothing and no one is perfect. It just takes a good eye to find those hidden imperfections.
author: Daphne Delacroix
category: eye, good, hidden, imperfection, inspirational, perfection, wisdom

quote: For the senses wander, and when one lets the mind follow them, it carries wisdom away like a windblown ship on the waters.
author: Anonymous, The Bhagavad Gita

quote: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man
author: but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.

quote: Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?
author: Confucius

quote: The most complicated skill is to be simple.
author: Dejan Stojanovic
category: complicated, dejan-stojanovic, literature, literature-quotes, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, quotes-to-live-by, simple, skill, thoughts, wisdom

quote: Obstacles are those frightening things you see when you take you eyes off your goal.
author: Henry James

quote: A man convinced against his will Is of the same opinion still
author: Dale Carnegie, How to Win Friends and Influence People

quote: Scared and sacred are spelled with the same letters. Awful proceeds from the same root word as awesome. Terrify and terrific. Every negative experience holds the seed of transformation.
author: Alan Cohen

quote: When Don Quixote went out into the world, that world turned into a mystery before his eyes. That is the legacy of the first European novel to the entire subsequent history of the novel. The novel teaches us to comprehend the world as a question. There is wisdom and tolerance in that attitude.
author: Milan Kundera, The Book of Laughter and Forgetting

quote: Where there is anger there is always pain underneath.
author: Eckhart Tolle, The Power of Now

quote: Communication is a skill that you can learn. It's like riding a bicycle or typing. If you're willing to work at it, you can rapidly improve the quality of very part of your life.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: If you want to fly on the sky, you need to leave the earth. If you want to move forward, you need to let go the past that drags you down.
author: Amit Ray, World Peace: The Voice of a Mountain Bird
category: fly-on-the-sky, leave-the-earth, let-go, let-go-of-attachment, let-go-of-clutter, letting-go, letting-go-of-the-past, life-and-living, life-lessons, life-quotes, past, past-and-future, self-discovery, wisdom, wisdom-of-life

quote: Adversity, if for no other reason, is of benefit, since it is sure to bring a season of sober reflection. People see clearer at such times. Storms purify the atmosphere.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance, order, rhythm and harmony.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Fashion and music are the same, because music express its period too.
author: Karl Lagerfeld
category: art, designer, express, fashion, karl-lagerfeld, life, music, period, quote, quotes, time, wisdom

quote: When you assume you make a you-know-what out of U and me. Yep, so let's stop assuming so much. We are often quick to explain details to strangers, who we understand might not be reading our minds, but we often assume that those people closest to us, those who share our household such as spouses, children parents and siblings, can read our minds. And we get upset with them when they don't go figure.I wonder how many angry words are directed not at an action or inaction as would at first appear, but simply at the fact that somebody did not read our minds.So let's give those people we care most about the benefit of the doubt and do a little less assuming and a little more explaining.
author: David Leonhardt

quote: It is very hard to be brave," said Piglet, sniffing slightly, "when you're only a Very Small Animal."Rabbit, who had begun to write very busily, looked up and said: "It is because you are a very small animal that you will be Useful in the adventure before us.
author: Benjamin Hoff, The Te of Piglet

quote: The mermaid is an archetypal image that represents a woman who is at ease in the great waters of life, the waters of emotion and sexuality. She shows us how to embrace our instinctive sexuality and sensuality so that we can affirm the essence of our feminine nature, the wisdom of our bodies, and the playfulness of our spirits. She symbolizes our connection with our deepest instinctive feelings, our wild and untamed animal nature that exists below the surface of outward personalities. She is able to respond to her mysterious sexual impulses without abandoning her more human, conscious side. What happened to the girls who dreamed of being mermaids?
author: Anita Johnston, Eating in the Light of the Moon: How Women Can Transform Their Relationship with Food Through Myths, Metaphors, and Storytelling

quote: Bitter your acts, bitter am I,Kindness your deeds, kindness am I,Pleasant and gentle, so you are,Fine honeyed lips and sweet talker.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi, Love: The Joy That Wounds: The Love Poems of Rumi

quote: Since there is no real silence, Silence will contain all the sounds, All the words, all the languages, All knowledge, all memory.
author: Dejan Stojanovic
category: dejan-stojanovic, knowledge, languages, literature, literature-quotes, memory, poetry, poetry-quotes, quotes, quotes-to-live-by, real, silence, sounds, thoughts, wisdom, words

quote: I believe that maturity is not an outgrowing, but a growing up: that an adult is not a dead child, but a child who survived. I believe that all the best faculties of a mature human being exist in the child. . . . that one of the most deeply human, and humane, of these faculties is the power of imagination.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin, The Language of the Night: Essays on Fantasy and Science Fiction

quote: REMEMBER YOUR GREATNESSBefore you were born,And were still too tiny forThe human eye to see,You won the race for lifeFrom among 250 million competitors.And yet,How fast you have forgottenYour strength,When your very existenceIs proof of your greatness.You were born a winner,A warrior,One who defied the oddsBy surviving the most gruesomeBattle of them all.And now that you are a giant,Why do you even doubt victoryAgainst smaller numbers,And wider margins?The only walls that exist,Are those you have placed in your mind.And whatever obstacles you conceive,Exist only because you have forgottenWhat you have alreadyAchieved.Poetry by Suzy Kassem
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: achieve, affirmation, attitude, beauty, big, birth, born, competition, confidence, courage, egg, existence, eye, fears, giant, great, greatness, human, inspirational, life, living-achievement, loser, losing, loss, obstacles, odds, pains, poem, poetry, race, small, sperm, strength, struggles, success, successful, suffering, survivor, suzy-kassem, victory, warrior, win, winner, winners, winning, wisdom

quote: If I’d stayed there, would I always have been happy? No, I suppose not. People move away, grow older, die, and the bright belief that there will be another marvelous thing around each corner fades. It is now or never; we must snatch at happiness as it flies.
